title:
Global well-posedness and scattering for the defocusing septic
  one-dimensional NLS via new smoothing and almost Morawetz estimates
abstract:
In this paper, we show that the one dimensional septic nonlinear
Schr\"odinger equation is globally well-posed and scatters in $H^s
(\mathbb{R})$ when $s > 19/54$. We prove new smoothing estimates on the
nonlinear Duhamel part of the solution and utilize a linear-nonlinear
decomposition to take advantage of the gained regularity. We also prove new
$L^{p+3}_{t,x}$ almost Morawetz estimates for the defocusing $p-$NLS adapted to
the low-regularity setting, before specializing to the septic case $p=7$.
